channel.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!
channel.description: WI'm SO excited! I just barely got my first song on SPOTIFY! It's crazy to think that just three years after getting Spotify I would be an artist on it! Auxy has really changed how I view music and now it's given me the opportunity to share my music with the world! Here's my Spotify if you want to check it out UPDATED: https://open.spotify.com/artist/4mSdBpHtlsvD4rMnXVI5Sa

item.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!
item.dc:creator: Peregrihn
item.description:
My Losing Sleep EP is out on Spotify featuring the hit track Dust Off That Analog, plus my five most recent tracks in a cool retro based wavy experience. Truly I have come far and still have far to go before I’m where I want to be but here’s to enjoying where we’re ag right now! Please listen, I appreciate all the support given by this community:

Spotify

Losing Sleep

Losing Sleep, an album by Insolidarity on Spotify

item.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!
item.dc:creator: MR_ANDERSON
item.description:
Hey everyone! I’ve teased a big “announcement” over the last while, to be revealed when I hit 300 followers on Soundcloud.

Well. I did.

So here it is! The big announcement! This announcement has multiple parts, so here goes:

Deep Space EP
I’m creating a six track EP, to be released late November or early December. As part of this announcement, I am releasing the first track, Sonnet, which is available on Soundcloud tonight.

Streaming Services
As per listener request, I will be releasing my best tracks on other streaming services such as iTunes and Spotify this month! Almost everything from Catalyst forward will be included, so stay tuned!

Lastly, I would like to take a moment and thank you all SO much for helping me to get to this point. 300 Soundcloud followers is obviously a big milestone, and I couldn’t have made it this far without this community. Thanks to everyone who has supported me on this journey!

That’s all I have to say for now! Stay tuned for updates on Deep Space EP as well as additional streaming services in the near future!

-MR. ANDERSON

Read full topic

Spotify

item.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!
item.dc:creator: VJM
item.description:
It was going to be VM until i found another artist with that name. But by then it was too late…
Also, yes, it’s just a preview and I know spotify isn’t quite the right place to put it, but it is my most played song to date so I’ll keep it up until I finish the full version.

Read full topic

item.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
A few points…

(SAMPLE)

Are you posting clips to Spotify?
Not sure of the value of that. “Sample” suggests a short teaser/taster/excerpt for the full track that’s coming later. (Not the same thing as the full instrumental version.)

Really not sure Spotify’s the right place to do that.
(I could be wrong. I’ve not seen it used that way before and it instinctively feels like a ‘not good’ idea, to me.)

Alternatively, if it’s the full length track and ‘…(SAMPLE)’ is just a creative/stylistic element of the track title, then that’s ok, of course.

 
If this release is genuinely intended to be the instrumentals from an upcoming release, then there are track naming conventions you could/should use - e.g. …

‘Album/release title (Instrumentals)’
‘Track title (Instrumental)’

 

VM / VJM

You had three letters to type and you honestly managed to get it wrong?

Afaik, you can’t change it while it’s up. You’ll likely need to delete the tracks/artist and reupload again with correct artist info.

Which is actually good, as it gives you the opportunity to review and revise the track titling.

Read full topic

item.title: Wooo I'm On Spotify!

item.description:
I’m on spotify too, here’s my artist page:

Spotify

VM

VM, Category: Artist, Singles: THE LVNDING, Fur Elise: The Remix, Get It (Instrumental), Stanley III (In Loving Memory), Empire (SAMPLE), Top Tracks: Fur Elise: The Remix, Empire (SAMPLE), Get It - Instrumental, Hey! A New Instrumental! -...


My artist name is actually VJM but I haven’t fixed it yet.
Also all the singles are instrumental versions of the songs for my upcoming album ALL CAPS.
